p: There have been several epidemics of the virus in the Indian subcontinent as well as Central Asia, Middle East, and Africa. The overall attack rates ranges from 1 to 15 % and is higher for adults than for children. In children attack rates are from 0.2 to 10 %. There is a high mortality among pregnant women. In endemic areas hepatitis E accounts for 50â€“70 % of cases of sporadic acute hepatitis. In those countries that are non-endemic, the infection is related to travel to endemic areas. A few patients are asymptomatic and are not jaundiced although most patients are icteric [ 94].
